outputs.output_descr: The objective of the project is to identify means to support Dominican Republic's own sustained capacity to fulfill its obligations in the context of the Stockholm Convention, including the preparation of a National Implmentation Plan focused on Persistent Organic Pollutants (POPs), that will more widely cover aspects important to the safe and environmentally sound management of chemicals and wastes, as called for in Chapters 19 and 20 of Agenda 21.  The National Implementation Plan will describe how the Dominican Republic will fulfill its obligations under the Convention to eliminate or reduce POP releases into the environment and carry our environmentally sound management of stockpiles of POPs-containing wastes and contaminated sites that pose high risks for health and the environment, with a regional perspective.

The National Implementation Plan will describe how the Dominican Republic will fulfill its obligations under the Convention to eliminate or reduce POP releases into the environment and carry our environmentally sound management of stockpiles of POPs-containing wastes and contaminated sites that pose high risks for health and the environment, with a regional perspective.

project_descr: Actividades Habilitantes de los contaminantes organicos persistentes en Republica Dominicana
